document.docAuthor: Khalaim, Andrey I. & Ward, Darren F.
document.docTitle: Aotearoazeus probles Khalaim & Ward 2018, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Tersilochinae (Hymenoptera: Ichneumonidae) from New Zealand. Part 1. Generic key and three new genera

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Tersilochinae (Hymenoptera: Ichneumonidae) from New Zealand. Part 1. Generic key and three new genera

heading.emphasis:
Aotearoazeus probles Khalaim & Ward
, sp. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph: Description. Female. Body length 4.0 mm. Fore wing length 3.4 mm .

Fore wing ( Fig. 11 ) with vein R1 not reaching apex of the wing. Veins Rs+2 r and Rs meeting at 85–90°. Vein 2mcu strongly antefurcal, vein 2rs-m short and thick. Postnervulus intercepted in its lower 0.3. Hind wing with vein cu1&cu-a somewhat reclivous. Legs slender, hind femur about 5.6× as long as broad and 0.8× as long as tibia ( Fig. 56 ).

Head, mesosoma and first tergite black; lower 0.5–0.7 of clypeus brownish. Mandible (teeth dark red or blackish) and palpi yellow. Antenna dark brown, scapus and pedicel usually yellowish or pale brown. Tegula yellow. Pterostigma brown. Legs reddish brown; hind coxa brownish black; hind tibia and tarsus fuscous (mid tarsus sometimes also fuscous). Metasoma behind first tergite predominantly dark brown, tergite 2 with broad posterior yellowish band, sometimes metasoma extensively yellowish brown behind mid of tergite 3.
Etymology. Named after its long foveate groove which is very similar to that in the genus Probles Förster.
